movies.title: Amours d'une moitié de siècle
movies.plot: Film a episodi. L'AMORE ROMANTICO. Elena, di nobile famiglia, ama il pianista Mario, ma il padre vuole che sposi un pretendente nobile e ricco. Con un inganno, la zia riesce ad indurre la fanciulla ad acconsentire alle nozze non volute. 1910. Nel periodo che precede la prima guerra mondiale, un medico favorisce con i suoi consulti gli adulteri dei suoi clienti. Un giorno, però, la scoperta del tradimento della propria moglie conclude degnamente la sua poco nobile attività. GUERRA 1915/18. Durante la prima guerra mondiale, Carmela e Antonio, due giovani abruzzesi, si sposano e aspettano un figlio. Antonio, chiamato alle armi, raggiunge il fronte e muore in battaglia proprio giorno in cui la moglie partorisce. EPOCA FASCISTA. Nell'ottobre del 1922, Alberto, infervorato per il fascismo, lascia il paese d'origine e la fidanzata, Susanna, e parte per Roma. Qui il suo entusiasmo si spegne nei locali notturni e nelle brevi avventure. Susanna, che è venuta a Roma per darsi al cinema, stuzzica...
movies.simplePlot: Film a episodi. L'AMORE ROMANTICO. Elena, di nobile famiglia, ama il pianista Mario, ma il padre vuole che sposi un pretendente nobile e ricco. Con un inganno, la zia riesce ad indurre la ...

biography.bio: Franco Interlenghi was born on October 29, 1931 in Rome, Lazio, Italy. He was an actor and writer, known for I Vitelloni (1953), Shoeshine (1946) and The Little World of Don Camillo (1952). He was married to Antonella Lualdi. He died on September 10, 2015 in Rome.
biography.name: Franco Interlenghi

biography.bio: Elegant Italian leading lady of the 50's and 60's, born Bruna Bovi, the youngest of five siblings in Rome. As a youth she was noted for her prowess as a gymnast, a fact which contributed to her discovery for the screen by the director Pietro Francisci in 1952. Possessed of luminous eyes and a spirited personality, Leonora was rarely cast as anything other than eye-candy in spaghetti westerns or sword-and-sandal epics. A couple of exceptions stand out: first, her titular role as Balkis, The Queen of Sheba (1952) (co-starring Gino Cervi, as King Solomon); secondly, -- arguably her best performance -- as Sandra Rubini, wife of an irresponsible ne'er-do-well and inveterate womanizer (played by Franco Fabrizi) in Federico Fellini's masterpiece I Vitelloni (1953). She also romped through a couple of mildly diverting horror flics. As Gordon Scott's girlfriend she battled faceless robots and vampires in Goliath and the Vampires (1961). In the off-beat Mario Bava offering Hercules in the Haunted World (1961), she was held on the island of the Hesperides under the control of a demon (Christopher Lee at his menacing best). Leonora's sporadic career as a movie actress was done and dusted by 1961 and she retired from acting at the end of the decade.
biography.name: Leonora Ruffo

biography.bio: Paola Borboni was born on January 1, 1900 in Golese di Parma, Emilia-Romagna, Italy. She was an actress, known for Roman Holiday (1953), I Vitelloni (1953) and Between Miracles (1971). She was married to Bruno Vilar. She died on April 9, 1995 in Bodio Lomnago, Lombardy, Italy.
biography.name: Paola Borboni

biography.bio: Carlo Ninchi was born on May 31, 1896 in Bologna, Emilia-Romagna, Italy. He is known for his work on Two Women (1960), Beauty and the Devil (1950) and Odessa in fiamme (1942). He died on April 27, 1974 in Milan, Lombardy, Italy.
biography.name: Carlo Ninchi

biography.bio: Luigi Tosi was born on July 15, 1915 in Verona, Italy. He was an actor and writer, known for Utopia (1951), Il marito (1958) and City of Pain (1949). He died on March 12, 1989 in Rome, Italy.
biography.name: Luigi Tosi

biography.placeOfBirth: San Pio Delle Camere, Abruzzo, Italy
biography.bio: Maria-Pia Casilio (5 May 1935 - 10 April 2012) was an Italian film actress, best known for her roles in "Umberto D". and "Un americano a Roma". Born in San Pio delle Camere, L'Aquila, Casilio was pretty active between 1952 and 1960, usually with the typical characterization of a querulous and naive small-town girl, then, after her marriage with the voice actor Giuseppe Rinaldi, she semi-retired from acting. On the Criterion Collection DVD release of "Umberto D". Vittorio De Sica comments she was a lucky charm to have her in his films.
biography.name: Maria Pia Casilio

biography.bio: Lauro Gazzolo was born on October 15, 1900 in Nervi, Liguria, Italy. He is known for his work on Goha le simple (1958), Father's Dilemma (1950) and Ring Around the Clock (1950). He died on October 2, 1970 in Rome, Lazio, Italy.
biography.name: Lauro Gazzolo

biography.bio: Albino Cocco was born on March 1, 1933 in Rome, Lazio, Italy. He is known for his work on Death in Venice (1971), The Leopard (1963) and The Damned (1969). He was married to Renata Franceschi. He died on March 7, 2003.
biography.name: Albino Cocco

biography.bio: Gustavo Serena was born on October 5, 1881 in Naples, Campania, Italy. He was an actor and director, known for Assunta Spina (1915), Zappatore (1930) and L'avarizia (1918). He died on April 16, 1970 in Rome, Lazio, Italy.
biography.name: Gustavo Serena

biography.bio: Amedeo Trilli was born on July 9, 1906 in Ronciglione, Lazio, Italy. He was an actor and writer, known for Knives of the Avenger (1966), I trecento della Settima (1943) and L'apôtre du désert (1939). He died on November 30, 1971 in Rome, Lazio.
biography.name: Amedeo Trilli

biography.bio: Silvana Pampanini was born on September 25, 1925 in Rome, Lazio, Italy. She was an actress and director, known for The Year Long Road (1958), The City Stands Trial (1952) and A Husband for Anna (1953). She died on January 6, 2016 in Rome, Italy.
biography.name: Silvana Pampanini

biography.bio: One of Italy's most captivating and talented cinematic comedy stars, Italian veteran Alberto Sordi was known for satirizing his country's social mores in pungent black comedies, farcical tales and grim drama. He, along with peers Vittorio Gassman, Ugo Tognazzi and Nino Manfredi, arguably represent the finest of post-war Italian cinema history. Born in Rome on June 15, 1920 in the Trastevere district, Sordi grew up in a musical family, his father being a tuba player for the Rome Opera House. A choir boy at the Sistine Chapel, he later trained for the theater in Milan but returned to Rome to work in radio and musical halls in comedy shows. In the late 30s he found his way into film as an extra. His first important role was in The Three Pilots (1942), a fascist war picture, but he wouldn't hit international stardom until a decade later when he starred in Federico Fellini's early films The White Sheik (1952) and I Vitelloni (1953). The titles of some of his most prolific characters were as simple as their titles: The Seducer, The Bachelor, The Husband, The Widower, The Traffic Cop, and The Moralist. Most of his protagonists amusingly, but not always pleasantly, stereotyped the worst attributes of Italian men and society, yet many of his films are unparalleled in quality and considered masterpieces. Sordi went on to star, direct and co-write more than 150 films. Never married and rather an introvert, he enjoyed a quiet, reclusive personal life. On his 80th birthday, he was made Mayor of Rome for the day. In 2002, after 190 films, he announced his retirement, and died of a heart attack the following year at age 82.
biography.name: Alberto Sordi

biography.bio: Giuseppe Porelli was born on November 24, 1897 in Naples, Campania, Italy as Giuseppe Porcelli. He was an actor, known for The Troops of St. Tropez (1964), Il Bazar delle idee (1940) and Carosello di canzoni (1958). He died on March 5, 1982 in Rome, Lazio, Italy.
biography.name: Giuseppe Porelli

biography.bio: Carlo Hinterman was born on April 2, 1923 in Milan, Lombardy, Italy. He is known for his work on Le avventure della squadra di stoppa (1964), Passioni (1989) and Les rangers (1970). He died on January 7, 1988 in Acireale, Sicily, Italy.
biography.name: Carlo Hinterman

biography.bio: Alba Arnova was born on March 15, 1930 in Bernal, Buenos Aires, Argentina as Alba Filomena Fossati. She is known for her work on Miracle in Milan (1951), La Gioconda (1958) and Times Gone By (1952). She was previously married to Gianni Ferrio.
biography.name: Alba Arnova

filmingLocations.location: Cinecittà Studios, Cinecittà, Rome, Lazio, Italy
